channel.title: How to pick a random bitmap? **solved**
channel.description: Ok, so i am making a script that on the page it will click on 9 out of the 10 bitmaps i have stored on my computer, it will click on 1 at a time randomly for 9 times. You may think this should go in the request forum part, well its only like 1/12 of my final script and i havent had any experience with bitmaps yet, so bitmapping is almost new for me. So here is the final statements-- i need someone to write a part of my script that will load 10 bitmaps, then it will go to the page and click on 9 out of 10 of them randomly, they can be repeated. So i need it to pick them randomly, so in reality it could pick all the same randomly. If you need the name of the bitmaps, they are button0.bmp button1.bmp... and up until button9.bmp. Post if you have questions or you have the part of the script part. thanx

item.title: How to pick a random bitmap? **solved**
item.dc:creator: @Nashi Nashi
item.description:
@Nashi wrote:

Actually Random(Range: Integer): Integer(Dunno if thats right) but anyway,
Random just generates a random number from 0 to the number below what you put in parenthesis
eg.
Random(20) would give 0-19.
Random(2) gives 0-1.

Also you could try something like procedure FindBitmaps; var BMP: Integer; begin case Random(3) of 0: BMP := Scar; 1: BMP := Computer; 2: BMP := Safari; end; if FindBitmap(x, y, BMP) then MoveMouseSmooth(X, Y); end;

Thats just an example though, and you will need to have declared the bitmaps in another procedure like Penguins had

Read full topic
item.source: How to pick a random bitmap? **solved**

item.title: How to pick a random bitmap? **solved**
item.dc:creator: @Nashi Nashi
item.description:
@Nashi wrote:

And it is possible to make an array, Since Bitmaps are Integers and putting them into the array and randomly choosing and Index number. Because that way would drastically reduce the amount of code you need, Since instead of Multiple procedures your could just put, Bitmaps[Random(3)] etc
Try reading an Array Tut before you try that though

Read full topic
item.source: How to pick a random bitmap? **solved**

item.title: How to pick a random bitmap? **solved**
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

For cases, if you made it

case random(3)

wouldn’t it be

case random(3) of
  0:Bitmap1;
  1:Bitmap2;
  2:Bitmap3;

If I remember correctly, that is how it should be written. The bitmap 3 would never be chosen in yours.

Thats just the way I learned it. Maybe you’re right too.

Read full topic

item.source: How to pick a random bitmap? **solved**

item.title: How to pick a random bitmap? **solved**
item.dc:creator: @Penguins Penguins
item.description:
@Penguins wrote:

Probably use cases. Example:

[code=delphi]program Test;
var
Safari, computer, scar : Integer;
i : Integer;

procedure Bitmaps;
begin
Safari := BitmapFromString2(False, ‘a919E278DA3D8C3912C0300’ +
‘803BF44CC61281363FEFFA458146E7676248D8888721C90BF07D2’ +
‘54D960C875E305FFE0C33BD74ECAD0F6813AC3E7032EBB3E03B55’ +
‘560C4DADC59599B7E5CC’);
computer := BitmapFromString2(False, ‘a71EAE78DA5DCB4112C02’ +
‘00843D12B5169509762E5FE4792B0ECE6CD1F868888C44EC44702’ +
‘5BA93D8D1DC6668A5935EA67542B576DBCBC60FFFFA7A61D41F5A’ +
‘39DF7BE419D2BF3EA59034579168E475CF59’);
scar := BitmapFromString2(False, ‘a3148478DA1D8C4B0E4021080’ +
‘3AF54E5A32E89F1DDFF488F96C5A419A00050BB81B88DF4624CD1’ +
‘1F8DD1CFED34BA892FE9279F5619F311D7A0395A58886CE8F9012’ +
‘92’);
end;

procedure Bitmap1;
var
x, y : Integer;
begin
if(FindBitmap(Safari, x, y))then
begin
ClickMouse(x, y, True);
end else
begin
WriteLn(‘Could not find bitmap one.’);
end;
end;

procedure Bitmap2;
var
x, y : Integer;
begin
if(FindBitmap(computer, x, y))then
begin
ClickMouse(x, y, True);
end else
begin
WriteLn(‘Could not find bitmap one.’);
end;
end;

procedure Bitmap3;
var
x, y : Integer;
begin
if(FindBitmap(scar, x, y))then
begin
ClickMouse(x, y, True);
end else
begin
WriteLn(‘Could not find bitmap one.’);
end;
end;

begin
Bitmaps;
repeat
Wait(400);
case Random(3) of
1 : Bitmap1;
2 : Bitmap2;
3 : Bitmap3;
end;
i := i + 1;
until(i = 9);
end.[/code]

That’s just a example. I used three bitmaps of Firefox, My Computer, and Safari.

The code loads the bitmaps, then gets a random number to three. If that random number is one, it does whatever is after 1 : which, calls the procedure to click on the first Bitmap, in my case, the Safari. Two would be the My Computer bitmap.

Get it? If you need more help post, yo.

Read full topic
item.source: How to pick a random bitmap? **solved**
